title: UK weather forecast: Sub-zero temperatures to blast Britain with widespread frost
text:

Britain will be gripped by sub-zero weather conditions as a frosty chill sweeps the country.

Today will be mostly dry with clear skies in the central and southern part of England.

However, the morning further north will begin with showers, particularly in Scotland and Northern Ireland.

Meteorologist Greg Dewhurst said: "Plenty of sunshine to come across the UK through today.

"But there will be a few showers in the north and the west and then with clearing skies there will be widespread frost for many of us.

"Showers will continue across the north and the west."

The Scottish Highlands will see a lot of wind, accompanied by hail, according to Mr Dewhuarst.

The northern coastal areas will see showers in the evening and overnight.

"In towns and cities, nine to 13C (48 to 55F) as a maximum, so yes, down on what we’ve seen over the last few days," the forecaster added.

"We could see lows of -3 or -4C (27 or 25F) leading to a frosty start Monday morning in central Scotland."

(Image: Adam Hughes / SWNS)

Five-day weather forecast

Today

Fine and dry with long sunny spells in central and southern UK. Showers in the north, these heaviest and most frequent across Scotland with coastal gales in NE.

Tonight

Long clear periods with daytime showers becoming confined to coastal counties of Scotland, Northern Ireland and north Wales. Cold for many with some frost and a few fog patches.

Monday

Many places dry with long spells of sunshine, albeit turning hazy in the southwest later. Cloudier in northern UK and along North Sea coasts with some showers.

Outlook for Tuesday to Thursday

Rather cold with sunny spells and a few showers through Tuesday and much of Wednesday with some frost overnight. Rain and strong winds spreading from the west on Thursday.
description: Britons will be able to enjoy a bit of sun today before the weather turns windy and showery as soon as Monday, the Met Office says
